page.title: 14FIRE STATION, RHYL
page.content: Rhyl Fire Station is to the east side of the town and consists of five fire engines, one SS25 hydraulic platform, one Range Rover Rescue and three water tenders. The station has 34 full-time and 21 part-time firemen with 4 officers. They have, by law, only four minutes to answer a call. The station is controlled by an Assistant Divisional Officer. There are 4 watches - blue, red, green and yellow. 9 men are in 3 and 8 men in the other one.They receive on average 8 calls per week. They have had a new Dodge Turbo engine which came on the 17th May, 1985. The new control room which cost Â£1,000,000 is fitted with 6 computers and a printer linked from there to the station by a radio link system.
